qas.question: An igneous rock is a rock that crystallizes from what?

answers.text: rock crystallizes from melt (magma and/or lava)

qas.question: Sedimentary rock can be turned into which of the three types of rock?
When the three types of rock are re-melted what is formed?
What are the three major types of rock?
What changes the mineral content of a rock?
What are three types of crystallization?
What is an important concept in crystallization?
What kind of mineral crystallizes from erosion?
What changes the way a mineral is deposited?
What happens when three types of minerals are re-deposited and change their characteristics?
What illustrates the relationships between rock and crystal?
Which type of rock cannot be re-melted?
What does heat prevent from changing in the crystallization process?
What gives sedimentary rock its characteristic fabric?

context: There are three major types of rock: <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><b5_0>igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic<b5_0/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>. <b6_0><b10_0>The rock cycle<b10_0/><b6_0/> is an important concept in geology which illustrates the relationships between these three types of rock, and magma. When a <a0_2>rock crystallizes from <a0_0><a0_1><a0_3>melt<a0_1/> (magma and/or lava)<a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_0/>, it is an <b7_0>igneous rock<b7_0/>. This rock can be <b12_0>weathered and eroded<b12_0/>, and then redeposited and lithified into a sedimentary rock, or be turned into a metamorphic rock due to <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><b8_0><b14_0>heat and pressure<b14_0/><b8_0/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> that change <b13_0>the mineral content<b13_0/> of the rock which gives it a characteristic fabric. The sedimentary rock can then be subsequently turned into a <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3>metamorphic<a1_3/><a1_1/> rock<a1_2/><a1_0/> due to heat and pressure and is then weathered, eroded, deposited, and lithified, ultimately becoming a sedimentary rock. Sedimentary rock may also be re-eroded and redeposited, and <b11_0>metamorphic<b11_0/> rock may also undergo additional metamorphism. All three types of rocks may be re-melted; when this happens, <b9_0>a <a2_0><a2_2>new <a2_3>magma<a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_0/> is formed<b9_0/>, from which an <a2_1>igneous<a2_1/> rock may once again crystallize.
